piece

Class GearedObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • piece.GearedObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Rack, Ring, Track, TrackLayout, Wheel

    public abstract class GearedObject
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines all of the properties shared by any element with gears. Geared objects are the overarching abstract class defining the functionality of any item with gears. These classes all rely on geometry objects to inform them about the perimeter and shape of their piece. This class, in turn, defines the gear count and placement.

      Constructs a geared object from the given shape.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GearedObject

        public GearedObject(Geometry shape)
        Constructs a geared object from the given shape. Sets the number of gears from the perimeter of the shape.
        Parameters:
        shape - the shape of the geared object. Determines number of gears.

    • Method Detail

      • connectTo

        public void connectTo(GearedObject peice)
        Creates a linking between the current peice and the parameter. If A.connectTo(B) is called, then B will rotate around A when drawn on a canvas.
        Parameters:
        peice - the piece to rotate around this piece.

      • getSceneElement

        public SceneElement getSceneElement()
        Returns the inner geometery of the Geared Object
        Returns:
        returns the encapsulated scene element. Used to define layouts on the canvas.

      • getGearRatio

        public float getGearRatio(GearedObject other)
        Parameters:
        other - the other geared object used to determine the gear ratio.
        Returns:
        the relative counts of each geared object. this / other

      • getGearCount

        public int getGearCount()
        Returns:
        the number of gears on the piece.
